result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Taylor N. Polar was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Taylor N. Polar was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.
Credit for 3 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: The defendant may not possess or consume alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor N. Polar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 1:51 PM. Also called 14CM02. Taylor Polar appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by Charles Simono. State- have resolution - on 14CM02 - amend #2 to county ordinance of bail jumping with a fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50, dismiss counts #1 and #3; on 14CF02 - plead to #1 as alleged and dismiss remaining counts. State and Polar agree. State- on 14CF02 - count #1- $1320 fine, 13 month DL suspension, 30 days jail, 18 months probation and jail is a condition#4 - amend to misd possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - $500 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $1355.50. Court - 14CM02 - dismiss #1 and #3, amend #2 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted and remaining bond goes on other case to pay fines. Court - 14CF02 - amend #4 to possession of THC and deleting 2nd and subsequent offenbse contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - reads new penalties, pleads NC, and pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Court dismisses #2 and #3 on 14CF02. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Polar withholds comments. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CF02 - count #4 - fine of $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $1355.50 - take bond posted, count #1 - impose 85 days in FC jail, stayed, place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: 30 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - report on 3/31/14 at 9:00 AM - 3 days credit only if revoked; fine of $1320.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, AODA and follow thru, 13 month DL suspension, IID for one year on DL and vehicle commencing upon issuance of valid DL, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendant's Response to Plaintiff's Demand for Discovery
Final pre-trial on March 26, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 3:19 PM. Also called 14CM02. Taylor Polar appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by Charles Simono. State - filing Information that mirrors complaint due to waiver of PH. Cirilli and Polar agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Cirilli has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both matters, set both matters for FPT on 3/26/14 at 1:15 PM.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:27 AM. Also called 14CM02. Taylor Polar appears in person and with counsel Gary Cirilli. State appears by Charles Simono. Cirilli has complaints for both cases, on CM - waives further reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Cirilli - on CF - waives reading, requests PH but waives time limits. Court sets CF for PH oin 1/29/14 at 3:00 PM and set CM for status at same time. Court continues bond on both cases.
